resources.string: That storm was something else. Does not bode well.
Wherever you come from, it's lost to you. This is your home now. \n\nAeternum. An isle of treacherous shores and lost memory, nothing as it was in the Old World.
You'll be wanting to visit the First Light settlement yourself soon enough. \n\nBut there's more work to be done here first, after that storm.
The storm preceding your arrival filled the skies with crimson.\n\nCorruption incarnate, I tell you.
First Light cannot afford to ignore this threat anymore. \n\nIf Corruption gets a foothold on the beach, it'll be at the settlement walls in a matter of days.
That storm was something else, I tell you. Does not bode well.
I hope your visit to First Light has been pleasant so far. Make no mistake, you are always welcome here.
It's funny to recall- there was even a crazy old man warning us about Corruption years ago...\n\nHm. Reveries aside, we'll need to think carefully about how to proceed.
One truth that never changes is that the First Light settlement always needs supplies.
Anytime you fancy, visit me or the town board outside and take any task that suits you.\n\nIn the meantime, there's more you can do with these refined materials.

I am still contemplating the precise strategy we should pursue to combat the Corruption.\n\nSome matters may be more urgent, however. There are reports of Corruption getting a hold closer to the settlement.
Let's hope that old man knows something that makes your travel worthwhile.\n\nIn the meantime, I'm still working out what's next for the settlement.
Why is it that in times of trouble, people are so quick to doubt their leaders? \n\nI suppose I will never understand.
Now matter how long you live, you never master the art of letting go of painful memories.
I must confess, I find I am always more at ease in your presence.
In case you are wondering, I am not oblivious to Magistrate Bond's investigation.
The dark mystery surrounding the fall of Nyhart's Anchorage has kept me awake many nights.
Despite the ugliness of everything we've learned, it's important we all get closure from what's come to light.
I have to tell you, {playerName}, our… partnership means a lot to me during these trying times.
You'll have to come back later. Just now, I have about - let's see - five separate crises to attend to.
I'll do everything I can to ensure First Light is prepared if the situation deteriorates. \n\nLet's just hope it's enough.
I would never consider living anywhere other than First Light.\n\nThis was once the greatest territory in all Aeternum, you know.
I will continue to do what I can here, but ultimately, it's up to Constable Oakes to rally the settlement.
If news of these corruption breaches opening up everywhere is true, we need all the help we can get.
Whichever faction achieves the most influence here, we must work with them for the good of the settlement.
I suppose you're aware by now that the Constable's plan consists of little more than hoarding food.
I have serious doubts about our Constable's priorities.\n\nWe must keep this quiet and proceed carefully.
I'm sorry if I caused any confusion, but I only had the settlement's best interest in mind. \n\nConstable Oakes will forgive me… I hope.
Fine day today for getting out and about, isn't it? \n\nPleasure meeting you, stranger.
These are strange times in First Light. \n\nMuch change is afoot. Gotta keep your head about you.
Rumors say the Corruption has spread inland. Some type of 'breaches' opening up everywhere. \n\nWe should've started preparing many moons ago.
You've hitched your wagon to the {playerFaction}, have you? Found your tribe?\n\nI suppose that means the settlement is safe now.
Hello there, friend. In case you wondered, I've still got those powder kegs in storage. \n\nArtificer Kim suggested we wait before resorting to such dire measures.
Been talking more to Artificer Kim since you've been about.\n\nTalking about you, in fact. Yes,we're both very proud of you.
Hey. I’m the local Survivalist. If you need any advice on how to navigate the rough wilds of this incredible place, I’m the one to talk to.
Greetings, traveler! If you venture outside the settlement, I would advise you exercise caution.
It's my belief that everyone in First Light should know their way around the forge.
I did not notice it when you first approached, but just now I saw it quite clearly. \n\nYou have a potent aura, my friend. The course of your destiny will affect that of many others.
Regardless of who's in charge here, my loyalty will always be to the people of First Light.\n\nDefending this settlement is no simple matter, however.
I understand that you gave a helping hand to the barkeep, Gunter Rost.\n\nThat was most good of you.
If my hypothesis is correct based on the failure of Gunter's brew recipe, this could be quite significant.
I have spoken with the Constable about our efforts.\n\nShe is understandably skeptical, but she fully supports us.
This is a great day for all of First Light.\n\nAnd we have you and Barkeep Rost to thank for it.
I hope you have found time to celebrate our successes.\n\nWe must take our victories where we can.
I am here in First Light to find those with strong arms and steel nerves.
You look like you've still got your sea legs. \n\nWell, you'll be right at home here with us. We Marauders are pirates, but on land!
Who's this bold warrior that approaches?\n\nPerhaps one who wants to better themselves? One who sees valor and discipline as the highest virtues?
I challenge you to meet with the other Factions.\n\n Then you will understand that we Marauders are the strongest.
Don't try and get one over on me, bookworm. I've learnt not to heed your kind.
Don't bother stopping here luminary, or you might end up dancing the hempen jig.
You're a Marauder now! So it's time to go on account. \n\nI've got a challenge for you here that will prove to be its own reward.
I salute you, fellow Marauder. We will never give up the fight, and in the end, we will emerge victorious.
You have questions, and the Syndicate is where you will find the answers. \n\nYou will return. The bones have told me as much.
The Syndicate is the only lifeline out of this cesspool. I don't know if I'd be here were it not…
The Covenant and the Marauders are just two different strains of idiocy. Go see for yourself.
I see that inquisitive sparkle in your eye. It is the same with us all.\n\nKnowledge stands above all things - that is our code.
Must you be just another dark shadow cast across me? Begone dark barbarian.
How's that Spark treating you? Funny, I see your followers suffering just like the rest of us.
Now that you are one of us, you will have access to vast knowledge… in time. \n\nBut first, I have a challenge for you.
I greet you in wisdom and mutual respect, fellow scholar.
By the grace of the Spark, is it not truly a wonder to be alive?
We seek and share the inspiration of the Spark. Hope is for all people, and in all people we nourish hope.
Share these good words with the other factions. You will see that giving is what fills the heart.
Do I see the spark of righteousness in this one?\n\nIn a world beset by darkness, we protect the spark and the light.
Go on my hasty friend. Slay those monsters. Collect that gold. None of it will fill your soul.
I do enjoy a brisk debate, but not today, my friend. \n\nPerhaps try to educate one of those Marauder buffoons. It would benefit all of us!
As a new member of the Covenant, you are now bound by sacred oath.\n\nWe cannot stand by and watch others suffer, we fight to protect the spark, no matter the odds.
My heart is filled with joy to see you again. Join with me in sacred service to the Spark.
All the hubbub going on around here, you think the place would be packed.
Crazy times. Everyone's bustlin' about, working together to strengthen the settlement. \n\nGotta admit, I'm feeling a bit snubbed. No one's asked for my help.
Still can't get over it, the favor you done me. \n\nYou're like a real friend. It's been… a long time. I can't even count the years.
Hey, you know what? I've made a big decision. \n\nYou are my new best friend. Seriously. Anytime you like, drinks on me.
Is is possible for two people to be like… even bester than best friends?\n\nLike bestest friends? Yeah. That's you and me, alright.
Welcome to 'The Everlasting Torch'! We're always burning for you.\n\nYou here to check in? Be my guest… literally!
You've become a real regular around here, haven't you? Hope this place is starting to feel like home.\n\nSay though, are you more of a townie? Or do you venture out into the great beyond?
Now that you caught a glimpse of Monarch's Bluffs, I trust you see why First Light is a damn nice place.\n\nThe Everlasting Torch is always burning for you!
Things seem to have quieted down here in First Light lately.\n\nI hope it's not just 'the calm before the Corruption comes', but I'll take a spot of peace when I can get it.
You know, I'm never one to turn away a good paying customer.\n\nBut you been here long enough - might want to look into buying a house, putting down roots.
Hello there, I am Master Fisher Clemenson. I can teach you much.
Hello there, I am Master Fisher Clemenson. I can teach you much.
Thank you for the bait and your assistance.
